snippet: French airstrikes overnight in Mali pushed back Islamist rebels from a key village and destroyed a rebel command center, France said, as West African nations promised a fast deployment of troops to Mali.
abstract: French airstrikes in Mali appear to halt Islamist rebel advance, as West African nations authorize what they say will be fast deployment of troops in support of weak Malian government.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and SCOTT SAYARE
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter contributed reporting from Bamako, Mali, Mark Mazzetti from Washington, and Eric Schmitt from Niamey, Niger.

lead_paragraph: French airstrikes overnight in Mali pushed back Islamist rebels from a key village and destroyed a rebel command center, France said, as West African nations promised a fast deployment of troops to Mali.

headline.seo: French Airstrikes Push Back Islamist Rebels in Mali
headline.main: French Airstrikes in Mali Deter Islamist Rebels
headline.print_headline: French Airstrikes in Mali Deter Islamist Rebels
